content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good exercise!
Good exercise for clash of code, an interesting mode would be the reverse mode

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice easy puzzle !
Just tested in IDE.  Looks good!  Fun exercise.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Ok-ish problem. Don't really like the fact that you need to simulate the operation but for beginners might be interesting.

Goal section
* Please change "values" to "digits" (2 times).

* Please change "for which" to "so".

Constraints section
* Please change "numbers" to "a number".

* Please add a space between ">=" and "0".

* Please change "item" to "character".

Cases
* Suggest to add a pair of cases where the last character is "x" and the second last character is an odd digit.

* Suggest to add a pair of cases where the input represents an integer.

* Suggest to add a pair of cases where the input represents 1 (edge case, the test can be the same as the validator).

* Suggest to add a pair of cases where the input represents 0 (edge case, the test can be the same as the validator).

Thanks.
This was originally submitted as clash, but based on suggestions resubmitted as Easy puzzle.
Great feedback, as usual. The case suggestions are very nice - I had to change my solution code for it, which shows you picked the right cases to add. Thanks a lot!

I actually first submitted this one as clash (I indeed had reverse in mind), but the general feeling there was that it was just too difficult for a Clash (a bit on the long end), so based on that feedback I resubmitted it as easy puzzle. It is an *easy* easy puzzle, so a nice one for beginners.

Congratulations on having the puzzle approved! I believe it is your first one (not counting clashes)?

Would you consider adding a cover picture to the puzzle? (Not compulsory, I'm just asking :) )

Thanks, first puzzle indeed! I've just added a cover picture, good reminder.

On editing approved contributions: apparently editing the cover picture does not change it's approval stage. However, for one of my clashes ('Quick, find a toilet') I got the feedback that there is a specific case with 100% test score but 25% validator score - do you know what happens to an approved clash if test/validator cases are modified?

If you edit an approved clash, the approval status won't be altered, and the players will play the revised clash in the future. So technically speaking there won't be any harmful side effects.

The only thing about editing a clash (or a puzzle for that matter) is whether it's respecting the original commenters and approvers in doing so. Usually editing should be avoided, but it's ok with good and sufficient justification. In the case of 'Quick, find a toilet', I think it's justified.

Yeah I kind of expected that it would go in again for approval. If that is not the case, it's flexible and efficient, but a bit dangerous as well; coming week I'll take my time to carefully update that clash.
